title: Implementing Theme Toggle
content:
I implemented a theme toggle using JavaScript and CSS using these approach:

1. CSS Theme Variables: Created light and dark theme variables in the :root selector using CSS for colors, backgrounds, borders, etc.
2. Theme Toggle Mechanism: The JavaScript toggle handler adds/removes the 'light-theme' class to the <body> element to switch themes.
3. Class-Based Styling: Used body.light-theme selectors to override dark theme variables with light theme values.
4. Theme Load: Saved user preference using localStorage.setItem('currentTheme', theme) and retrieved it on page load.
5. System Preference Detection: Used window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: light)') to detect system preference.
6. Visual Feedback: Dynamically changed the button icon between moon (dark) and sun (light) using classList.replace().

title: Dynamic Blog Implementation
content:
I implemented a dynamic blog section that loads content from a JSON file using JavaScript:

1. JSON Structure: Created a posts.json file with an array of blog post objects containing title, date, and content.
2. Fetch API: Used fetch('data/posts.json') to retrieve blog contents from the posts.json file.
3. DOM Manipulation: For each post:
  • Created a <div> container and other elementswith document.createElement().
  • Applied styling through CSS classes on the 'Blog Page Styles' section (i.e. blog-post).
4. Date Handling: Converted dates to locale format using new Date().toLocaleDateString().
5. Error Handling: Implemented basic error catching with .catch().

title: Current Goals
content:
Now that I am graduating from University soon, I have started thinking about my next steps into the professional world. I am particularly interested in the Cybersecurity field, and I am currently working on getting my certifications as well as learning some tools that are widely used in the industry, particularly SIEM tools. I have gotten my Google Cybersecurity Certification and am currently studying for the CompTIA Security+ Certification, which I will be taking soon. I am also planning on joining the winter Co-op program to test my luck and hopefully get a little bit more experience, just to make job hunting a bit easier after graduation.

I know it's a little late to be thinking about these things on my last year of University, but better late than never I guess. I do hope that it will all, or atleast some of it, work out somehow and for my preparations to bear fruit.
